paper_abstract: Audio processors like Audacity provide a "hear-and-see" learning tool for basic acoustics, combining sound and image. Activities designed as laboratory experiments with PC (even at home!) have been already successfully implemented, for example, about the dependence of timbre and acoustic spectrum, of pitch and frequency, and of loudness and amplitude. (C) 2009 Wiley Periodicals, Inc. Comput Appl Eng Educ 17: 379-388, 2009: Published online in Wiley InterScience (www.interscience.wiley.com): DOI 10.1002/cae.20207
paper_title: Audio Processors as a Learning Tool for Basic Acoustics
